catplat.bonding package

Submodules

catplat.bonding.lewis module

This module consist of code to solve the Lewis Structure of a chemical species.

class catplat.bonding.lewis.LewisStructure(atoms: Atoms | AtomsWrapper | GratomsWrapper, multiple_bonds: bool = True)[source]

Bases: object

Lewis structure of a chemical species.

A list of bonding attributes can be obtained:

For Example:
>>> ls = LewisStructure.from_adsorbate('CO')
>>> ls.num_lone_pairs()
[0, 1]
atoms

Structure of chemical species

Type:

Atoms

multiple_bonds

Toggle on whether multiple bonds (e.g. C=C should be considered)

Type:

bool

VALENCES = {'C': 4, 'Cl': 7, 'H': 1, 'N': 5, 'O': 6, 'P': 5, 'S': 6}
classmethod from_adsorbate_name(name: str, **kwargs)[source]

Convenient way to initiate LewisStructure from adsorbate name. :param name: Name of adsorbate to analyze :type name: str

get_bonds(denticity: int | str | None = None)[source]

Returns the Bonds of an adsorbate. Uses the bond priority list (self.bonds_index) to return the predicted adsorbate bonds. By default, this function returns the bonds which has the same length as denticity.

Parameters:

denticity (int, str, None) – Denticity of adsorbate. Defaults to ‘monodentate’.

property is_single_atom: bool
num_bonds() → list[source]

Number of covalent and dative bonds on each atom.

num_free_electrons() → list[source]

Number of free electrons on each atom.

num_lone_pairs() → list[source]

Number of lone pairs on each atom.

num_unsaturated_bonds() → list[source]

Number of unsaturated bonds on each atom.

radical_atoms() → list[source]

Indices of radical atoms with odd numbers of free electrons.

unsaturated_atoms() → list[source]

Indices of unsaturated atoms with one or more unsaturated bonds.

catplat.bonding.lewis.is_odd(val)[source]

Returns True/False for value if they are odd/even.
